column3: U-111 (Kptlt. Wilhelm Kleinschmidt). Sunk on 4 October 1941 in the North Atlantic south-west of Tenerife
column7: by depth charges and gunfire from the British anti-submarine trawler HMS Lady Shirley.

column3: U-131 (KrvKpt. Arend Baumann). Sunk on 17 December 1941 in the North Atlantic north-east of Madeira
column7: by depth charges and gunfire from the British escort destroyers HMS Exmoor and HMS Blankney
column9: the British corvette HMS Pentstemon and the British sloop HMS Stork and by gunfire from a Martlet aircraft* (802 Sqn FAA) of the British escort carrier HMS Audacity.

column3: U-136 (Kptlt. Heinrich Zimmermann). Sunk on 11 July 1942 in the North Atlantic west of Madeira
column6: by depth charges from the Free French destroyer Léopard
column7: the British frigate HMS Spey and the British sloop HMS Pelican.

column3: U-173 (Oblt. Hans-Adolf Schweichel). Sunk on 16 November 1942 in the North Atlantic west of Casablanca
column6: by depth charges from the US destroyers USS Woolsey

column3: U-524 (Kptlt. Walter von Steinaecker). Sunk on 22 March 1943 in the North Atlantic south of Madeira
column7: by depth charges from a US Liberator aircraft (2nd A/S Sqn USAAF/T).

column3: U-167 (KrvKpt. Kurt Sturm). Scuttled on 6 April 1943 in the North Atlantic off Gran Canaria
column7: after being badly damaged by depth charges from two British Hudson aircraft (233 Sqn RAF/L & W) on 5 April.

column3: U-182 (Kptlt. Asmus Nicolai Clausen). Sunk 16 May 1943 north-west of Madeira Islands
column6: by depth charges from the US destroyer USS MacKenzie.

column3: U-135 (Oblt. Otto Luther). Sunk on 15 July 1943 in the North Atlantic east of Canary Islands
column6: by depth charges from the British sloop HMS Rochester
column7: the British corvettes HMS Mignonette and HMS Balsam and a US Catalina aircraft (VP-92 USN/P-6).

column3: U-515 (Kptlt. Werner Henke). Sunk at 1510hrs on 9 April 1944 in the North Atlantic north-west of Madeira
column7: by rockets from two Avenger and two Wildcat aircraft (VC-58 USN) of the US escort carrier USS Guadalcanal and depth charges from the US destroyer escorts USS Pope

column3: U-68 (Oblt. Albert Lauzemis). Sunk on 10 April 1944 in the North Atlantic north-west of Madeira
column7: by depth charges and rockets from two Avenger and a Wildcat aircraft (VC-58 USN/T-22
column8: T-24 & F-4) of the US escort carrier USS Guadalcanal.

column3: U-549 (Kptlt. Detlev Krankenhagen). Sunk on 29 May 1944 in the North Atlantic south-west of Madeira
column7: by depth charges from the US destroyer escorts USS Eugene E. Elmore and USS Ahrens.

column3: U-543 (Kptlt. Hans-Jürgen Hellriegel). Sunk on 2 July 1944 in the North Atlantic south-west of Canary Islands
column6: by depth charges and a Fido homing torpedo from an Avenger aircraft (VC-58 USN/T-30) of the US escort carrier USS Wake Island.

column3: U-154 (Oblt. Gerth Gemeiner). Sunk on 3 July 1944 in the North Atlantic north-west of Madeira
column7: by depth charges from the US destroyer escorts USS Inch and USS Frost.
